content: Do you agree that everything in the following story is fictional?
One of these days, you are, as usual, busy with your studies at Wittenberg University. A message is brought to you, from which you learn that your father, the king of Denmark ,died.
My lord, your father's funeral

answers.answer: I know. I will head back to Denmark for the funeral.
I do not care. Let them mourn. I will not go back.

content: Back to Denmark
My cousin Hamlet, and my son!
This is your uncle. Not only does he become the new king, he is also marrying your mother. This uncle, is indeed a little more than kin, and less than kind.
Hamlet, stay here. Do not go back to the university. Think of me as of a father, and you are the most immediate to my throne.

answers.answer: Villain! Beast! I will kill you!
Yes, my lord. I will stay here.

content: You get back to your room, and cannot stop thinking of father's death. At this time, Horatio, an old friend, comes.
My lord, I saw the king your father last night.

answers.answer: The king my father! For God's love, let me hear.

content: It was a figure like your father. For three nights, it walked upon the platform. I warrant it will walk again tonight.

answers.answer: I will watch tonight with you.
It must have been your illusion, Horatio.

content: Night falls very soon. The ghost appears.
I am thy father's spirit. If thou didst ever thy father love, revenge his foul and most unnatural murder.
Now, what do you plan to do?

answers.answer: I shall go to uncle, and question him.
I need to make a smart plan.

content: You gradually discover the truth. Father's ghost was right. Uncle is a murderer. You kill him in the end. At the same time, he poisons you. The hero and the villain perish together.
Only those who have agreed have the privilege of starting this game. Unfortunately, I cannot allow you to partake in this game. Goodbye.
20 years have passed. There isn't a day that you don't regret your indifference. Depression keeps torturing you.
You underestimated the evil and cunning of your uncle. Upon hearing this, he becomes alert, and later secretly kills you.
Very well. As you wish.
Horatio tries hard to tell you what he saw last night, but you refuse to listen to him. Little does he talk to you from then on. Life goes on, but you've lost an important friend.
Life goes on, without knowing the truth.
